title: Best Audiobook Player
comment: There's a decent number of audiobook player options on the Play Store, but this one is the best. It has all the features you need in an extremely clean, material interface. Absolutely no issues or complaints.
Well designed and works as advertised
Easy navigation, also simple and free.
Amazing app. Extremely underdownloaded!

title: Excellent
comment: Best audiobook player I've used.

This app is criminally under downloaded especially for being free and from what it looks like not overly accessing your private information. For a free and open Media Player it is spectacular. Don't let the audiobook part of the title throw you off. It plays just about everything audio wise. Have not tried it for video so I don't know if it plays that. So what I got it for was for my audio books and the podcast and frankly anything that was longer in length then a song. I was tired of the stock Android players that would lose my place in a podcast or a book etc when I would pause for too long or got a phone call or any general destruction that you will get using a phone. The only thing keeping it from a perfect score is if they instituted A podcast locating and downloading service.

Dear Lordfuture1. Thanks for the feedback :). I want to focus on audiobooks only. A good open source podcast catcher / player is AntennaPod. Maybe give it a try. Cheers,
Paul
Simple, effective, good looking!

title: Material Player
comment: Great app, simple design and very easy to use. Bonus that it remembers playback position. Would like to see more features though and IT SHOULD HAVE A PAID VERSIOB!!!!! I'd would happily pay a fiver for this great app.....

title: One small problem.
comment: Most beautiful and elegant audiobook player ever seen. One problem though: This app seems to ignore CD-number tags. The tracks of multi-CD Audiobooks aren't sorted correctly, thus rendering this app useless for those.
Minimal and material!
Has potential, but huge huge flaw. doesn't have the ability to refresh its content after the first initial run which means that newly added audiobooks are not found.
They are. Just give it some time.

title: Sleep timer
comment: How do u disable the sleep timer?
Click on it again. Cheers, Paul

Best

title: exactly what I was looking for
comment: thank you so much for making this open source

This is the worst audio book app I've ever used between constantly crashing while trying to load my audio or crashing in the middle of trying to play audio I've only gotten this app to work 6 times. I don't recommend this to anyone. Updated review: it still crashes every time I start a new book and still occasional goes into a crash loop.
Hmm. weird. DId you send the report? I cant see any for the latest version.

This concept is simply wrong. I want to be able to choose a root folder that I could open in the player and select the audio file that I want to hear. This player only allows me to play the whole folders with the entire content with no way to show me the list of the content and let me simply select the book I want to play. The developer presumed that everyone had all their audio books in separate folders..

title: Greatest audiobook player out there
comment: Can't say enough good things. Only feature if like to see is Android Auto support.

title: The best audiobook player (ever!)
comment: This is by far the best audiobook app I have seen on android, and it doesn't hurt that it is open source(free). The only problem I have with the app is how there is only one option for a sleep timer, but it is small enough to pretty much ignore. To whomever created this app, I am truly grateful for you investing your time to create it.

title: Extra basic, extra good
comment: This is pretty much everything you want in an audio book player. It's a smidge more basic than I might like (only one sleep time, loading of folders one by one) but these are small ux quibbles. The only major missing feature is chapter support on .MPa files, but I imagine this would be highly complex and thus be against the simplicity design philosophy.

title: Good app
comment: So far I like this quite well I only wish it had a sleep timer count down visible on screen.

title: Great!
comment: Works on books that I can't get through Audible, smooth interface and simple. Just what I was looking for. Open source is always a plus. Thanks!
Simple, good looking, and intuitive. Must have audiobook player.

title: Very pretty
comment: It's so lovely to come across a really simple, well designed audiobook player. So nice how it handles my audiobook folder and adding art too. My No. 1 feature request would be the ability to sort my audiobooks by author!

title: Great app
comment: Does exactly what it says on the tin. Super material design with nice flowing animations. Android wear support wouldn't go a miss maybe in future updates?

title: the best
comment: hands down best audio book player ..only feature required is to make single click bookmark feature ... instead of two step process

title: Best
comment: Great!!! Don't look anywhere else. Donate and skip one days worth of coffee!

title: Excellent start. Missing some features
comment: Good first impression. Esential information missing out.. e.g. total time (of all files, not just current). Additional info and different views for library. History and global bookmarks

title: Needs Android Auto Support
comment: Overall a good simple app. Needs Android Auto support.

title: Love it!
comment: I've been using this a lot lately on long drives, and this is the best audiobook app I've used. I love that I can just reach over and tap the middle of the screen to pause and play rather than having to find a small button while driving. I wish that I could speed up past 2x speed though, and it'd be nice if there was an on screen volume slider. And I still haven't figured out how to apply the lock screen.

title: Does what it says
comment: Only audiob ok player I've found that does what it is supposed to do.

title: The best app for audiobooks
comment: I installed it from Google Play only to be able to give it 5 stars, because I already had it from F-Droid :D

title: Nice design, User friendly, Open source
comment: This is the BEST audiobook player I know of so far. Even better, open source and of course no ads. IAP is for donation. The author give access to issue tracker so we can submit bugs or feature requests. The GUI still needs improvements. The app is very usable by now, in a few more updates, I am sure this is the best audiobook player.  BTW, I have tried many audiobook players. Most of them have something bad, either an over complex configuration (Mortplayer audiobook) or some weird GUI decision to fit a bad habit (treating audiobook navigation as an ePub as in Listen Audiobook Player).

title: Free software at its best
comment: Annoyed that a $20 mp3 player has better user experience for playing audiobooks than your $500 phone? This app completely reverses that by adding all the touches specific to audiobook playback that you may not even have thought of.  Most importantly, it allows you to easily seek backward or forward by a configurable number of seconds right from the lock screen. Even better, you can use long press on the volume button to achieve the same thing without turning the screen on at all! No more having to enter your pin, open Google Music, and futz around trying to touch the correct point on the seek bar because you missed an essential passage in your audiobook.  There is *very* fast response to user requests and bug reports in spite of the fact that it is free of charge, and has no ads. Furthermore, being open source, installing it on your phone doesn't give you that dirty feeling or suspicion that your data is being stolen.  Given that a lot of crappier apps charge, harass,  and/or spy on you, you should really consider donating if you find this app useful.

title: FINALLYYYUUYYYY
comment: I love it

title: Best audiobook-app I've used
comment: It looks great, is easy to navigate and there´s a jump-back-20-seconds-button. You get cover artwork and you can set playback speed.  Everything you need from an audiobook-app!
Plays audio books well. No clutter, great sound quality and nice bookmark feature. Cant complain for the price.

title: The last update ruined it
comment: It was a great player. After the last update it recognizes each disk of the book as a separate book. It doesn't even remember the last position where I left the book. It starts from the beginning every time. Can you provide me the apk of the version before these last few updates? If not, I'll have to go look for another player.. :(

Dear Ronak,
it seems you added your book as "Folder with multiple books". When you add a book, you can chosse "Single book". That way it wont get recognized as a sperate book.
For the not saving of positions: That should now be fixed.
If you have any questions, write me a mail to: woitaschek@posteo.de

title: UPDATE
comment: I use this app on a daily basis and since the update it hasn't worked right.   It doesn't remember the last place I listened to.   If I haven't made a mental note of the last place then it takes me ages to find my place..  I've tried the bookmark function but god knows where they go when I return to the app..   This is my first ever review on an app,  I feel really disappointed and I am regretfully  looking for a replacement app.

Dear Kelly,
there was a problem with writing to external storages in the last version. If the app still does not remeber your position of you have any questions, please write me a mail to: woitaschek@posteo.de

title: Super glitchy on HTC One M8
comment: The app worked great before, and while I do appreciate the new features, they don't work on HTC One M8. The app constantly crashes, the album covers don't load, and it never remembers the place where I left off. Please fix this. Thanks!

Dear Abner, there was a problem with writing to external storages in the last version. If the app still does not remeber your position of you have any questions, please write me a mail to: woitaschek@posteo.de

title: Resets on every update
comment: I appreciate the simple UI, the material design and the quickness. One big problem is that it resets all settings on every update; all books you have imported are removed from the app and you have to reimport them. Along with this you loose your listening locations, so you have to figure out where you left off on every audio book you were listening to. Very annoying.
Dear Amaury, the app should no longer loose positions as of the coming update. Sorry for that. If you have questions, suggestions or bugs, please write me a mail to: woitaschek@posteo.de

title: Includes all the features necessary
comment: Works really well. I haven't experienced any crashes yet. And on top of that it's open source. Please keep the app going. I'm happy to support even on dev side if needed. Just one issue - latest update removed all my bookmarks and book cover art.

Dear Ankur, really sorry about that, that don't happen again. I changed all of the underlying implementation, so it was not possible to maintain them. But for future all the config is stored next to the book, so even after reinstalling the app all you positions and bookmarks you save now are stored permanently. The config remains.
Sorry again,
Paul

title: Simple and sleek
comment: Thank you, Paul. This app is exactly what I was looking for. The simple, yet practical, design is it's biggest plus. If you're just looking to listen to some audiobooks without having to weave your way through a convoluted set of functions and options, most of which don't even work properly and slow the listening experience, like with some of the other players out there, then this is the app for you.

title: Simple and effective
comment: Only has the necessary permissions, works quickly and as expected, awesome!

title: Clean, well developed app
comment: On thing I have been waiting for ever since converting to android, is an audio book reader that actually reads just audio books and saves you spot for easy returns. This is it! Love it!

Hey Japheth,

thanks for your feedback. If you have any suggestions or find any bugs, please open a ticket on github: https://github.com/Ph1b/MaterialAudiobookPlayer/issues

Thanks, Paul

title: Nice UI, does what it should.
comment: I had been searching for a lightweight, clean player for audio book listening. Material Player is definitely my favorite. Remembers last position in all books (not just the last one I listened to), lets me store my books where I choose, and has nice lock screen controls. Keep up the good work!
Hey, thanks for your feedback. Do you have any suggestions for improving the app? Thanks, Paul
